document_title: Right-sided migraine: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_name: dau-nua-dau-ben-phai.json_6_How to treat migraine or right-sided headache
subsection_content:
To improve the condition of right-sided migraine headaches, in addition to going to the doctor and doing the necessary paraclinical indications to determine the cause and get timely treatment, you can apply some of the following tips:
Rest in a dark, quiet space; Move away from areas with too bright lights, constantly flashing lights, or too loud sounds; Take a warm bath.; Apply warm or cold compresses to the back of the neck; Limit or avoid foods that can cause headaches, including alcohol, caffeine, and MSG.; Drink plenty of water, avoid dehydration; Massage tense muscles in the neck and shoulders.; Avoid tying your hair too tightly; Do not use electronic devices such as phones, televisions, tablets, etc.; Use over-the-counter pain relievers in moderation, avoid using too much to limit the recurrence of right-sided migraines due to drug abuse.; Listen to relaxing music; Do breathing exercises to relieve pain and reduce stress and anxiety.; Apply aromatherapy, using essential oils such as eucalyptus, lavender or peppermint to treat right-sided migraines caused by stress.
However, as mentioned, the most important thing is that the patient should still go to the hospital to check the cause of the pain instead of arbitrarily taking medicine at home without instructions from a doctor.
See more: 17 Ways to treat migraines at home for quick relief without medication.
